Definition:
A specific durable physical device used in diagnosis or treatment. The value is the coding for a type of device, for example, a CPAP machine. The same device might be used on multiple patients.
Device status cannot be reconciled between Argonaut and US-Core, each having different required value sets.
Device type has extensible mappings to different value sets in Argonaut and US-Core, however both value sets have identical SNOMED content (descendants of 49062001 (Device). We adopt the US-Core value set, which is allowable because the binding is extensible.

Short: Elements that belong to all information items.
Definition: Elements that belong to all information items.

Short: A human language, spoken or written.
Definition: A human language, spoken or written.

Short: A set of rules under which this content was created
Definition: A set of rules under which this content was created

Short: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.
Definition: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

Short: Captures the reason for the current state of the procedure.
Definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the procedure.

Short: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.
Definition: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.

Short: Business identifier or external id for this resource.
Definition: Business identifier or external id for this resource.

Short: The larger entity that the asserted item is a portion of. For example, an organization part of a larger organization, or an encounter with a hospitalist might be part of a larger hospitalization encounter.
Definition: The larger entity that the asserted item is a portion of. For example, an organization part of a larger organization, or an encounter with a hospitalist might be part of a larger hospitalization encounter.

Short: Structure of the Unique Device Identifier (UDI) Barcode string number for a device, assigned by the organization using the device.
Definition: Structure of the Unique Device Identifier (UDI) Barcode string number for a device, assigned by the organization using the device.

Short: The distinct identification string as required by regulation for a human cell, tissue, or cellular and tissue-based product.
Definition: The distinct identification string as required by regulation for a human cell, tissue, or cellular and tissue-based product.

Short: The name of the company who produced the item.
Definition: The name of the company who produced the item.

Short: When the item (medication, device, etc.) was produced.
Definition: When the item (medication, device, etc.) was produced.

Short: When the item (medication, device, etc.) will expire.
Definition: When the item (medication, device, etc.) will expire.

Short: A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch.
Definition: A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch.

Short: Serial number assigned by the manufacturer.
Definition: Serial number assigned by the manufacturer.

Short: The name of the device as given by the manufacturer.
Definition: The name of the device as given by the manufacturer.

Short: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.
Definition: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.

Short: The model number of the device, assigned by the manufacturer or vendor.
Definition: The model number of the device, assigned by the manufacturer or vendor.

Short: A string associated with the product that identifies a particular release iteration.
Definition: A string associated with the product that identifies a particular release iteration.

Short: A person in the role of a patient. Sometimes, the patient is not the subject of information in a clinical statement where the Patient is the SubjectOfRecord.
Definition:
A person in the role of a patient. Sometimes, the patient is not the subject of information in a clinical statement where the Patient is the SubjectOfRecord.

SHR follows Argonaut and makes the value set binding on marital status required. MaritalStatus has a required binding in Argonaut, but an extensible binding in US-Core. To be feasible under both DSTU2 Argonaut and STU3 US-Core, the required binding strength is adopted.

Short: An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the device.
Definition: An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the device.

Short: An electronic means of contacting an organization or individual.
Definition: An electronic means of contacting an organization or individual.

Short: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility.
Definition: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility.

Short: A unique URL on which the device may be contacted directly.
Definition: A unique URL on which the device may be contacted directly.

Short: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.
Definition: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.

Short: Provides additional safety characteristics about a medical device, for example, 'contains latex'.
Definition: Provides additional safety characteristics about a medical device, for example, 'contains latex'.
